title: New Nvidia Blackwell chip for China may outpace H20 model
author: Muhammad Zulhusni
essence:
**Nvidia’s Game-Changing Blackwell Chip for China: A Leap Beyond U.S. Export Limits**

Nvidia is secretly developing a **Blackwell-based AI chip** for China—potentially **far more powerful** than its current H20 (a U.S.-restricted, watered-down version of the H100). While the U.S. bans advanced AI chips like the **B200** (Blackwell’s flagship) from China, this new design could **sidestep restrictions** by tweaking specs while retaining near-cutting-edge performance.

title: This “smart coach” helps LLMs switch between text and code
author: Adam Zewe | MIT News
essence:
**MIT’s *CodeSteer* is a game-changing "smart coach" that supercharges LLMs by dynamically switching between *text* and *code*—like a human flipping between reasoning and calculating.**

**What’s new?** Unlike today’s LLMs (which falter on math/logic or over-rely on brittle code generation), CodeSteer *actively steers* the model to alternate between natural language and executable code until it arrives at a correct, verifiable answer—like solving a supply-chain puzzle by *both* describing constr
reactions: Perspective 1 on this MIT AI story

title: Chan Zuckerberg Initiative’s rBio uses virtual cells to train AI, bypassing lab work
author: Michael Nuñez
essence: The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative unveils rBio, a groundbreaking AI model that simulates cell biology without lab experiments to accelerate drug discovery and disease research.
reactions: **Technology Perspective (AI/Computational Biology):**

*"rBio’s ‘soft verification’ paradigm is a leap toward *in silico* biology—by decoupling AI training from wet-lab constraints, it not only slashes costs but also exposes a critical blind spot: how do we quantify and bound the *simulation-to-reality gap* when virtual cells, no matter how sophisticated, remain abstractions of chaotic biological systems?"*
